June
Twenty-seventh,
1 9 2 %
Supervisor Milo F. Kent,
Chairman Airport Committee,
Board of Supervisors,
City and County of San Francisco,
City Hall, San Francisco.
Dear Sir:
At the time the San Francisco Chamber of Commerce recommended.
to the Supervisors the establishment of meteorological stations at
contemplated airport sites, they also recommended
the
that this work should
be supplemented by actual flying conditions.
that time I discussed the matter with Major Clagett,
Commanding Officer of
the Ninth Corps Division.
He informed me
that
the Government would be
glad to cooperate, but that they had a very
limited amount of gasoline allotted for their work, and if the City
would supply the necessary gasoline the Government would furnish the
plane and pilot and would be pleased to make the necessary observations.
the period of
1 of one or harn ghas over all 00 ottomplated F01 ds
one year, making flights over all
two
to three times
discussed this matter with Major Clagett
again about a week
ago,
and he stated that the proposition was still
open.
As we commence
our meteorological examinations on the lst of
July, it seems to me to be advisable that the flying tests should cover
the
same
period.
I would be pleased to take up this matter with Major Clagett
if the
Committee so desires, or your Committee can attend to the
matter
directly.
Very truly yours,
RIGHT OF WAY AGENT.
JJP: KH
properties.sfomuseum:airport: Mills Field Municipal Airport of San Francisco
properties.sfomuseum:description: Facsimile of correspondence from Joseph J. Phillips, Right of Way Agent for City and County of San Francisco, to Supervisor Milo F. Kent, Chairman of Airport Committee, Board of Supervisors, dated June 27, 1927, concerning establishment of meteorological stations in conjunction with lease of Mills Estate property in San Mateo County for use as airport; file copy, not signed or mailed.
properties.wof:name: correspondence: Joseph J. Phillips, Right of Way Agent for City and County of San Francisco
